# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(word) + length(current_line) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word * " "
        else
            current_line *= word * " "
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
wrap_string("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.")."````
This `wrap_string` function takes a text as an argument with a default value of `text_width=10` for the maximum width of a line. It splits the text into words, then iterates through them, adding each word to the current line if it fits within the width limit. If the word exceeds the limit, it starts a new line and continues with the next word. Finally, it collects all the lines and joins them with newline characters to return the wrapped text.
